title: Unit 5 Lesson 6: Convolution/Stencil Code in MPI
description: This lesson introduces the convolution/stencil algorithm. The implementation for the 5 stencil <u>serial</u> code applied to a simple heat transfer simulation is presented and profiled. The lesson explains at a high level how to solve and accelerate the code in MPI with a timing comparison of serial vs distributed graphs; the code can be run on a laptop and shows how to run on a cluster assuming access to Blue Waters or another supercomputer. The lesson is followed by an activity about changing the code to 3D. The code is also in OpenMP (different unit) so their execution time can be compared.
